head.title: Semantics Alone Won't Save Clinton; No Nixonian Massacre

hedline.hl1: Semantics Alone Won't Save Clinton; No Nixonian Massacre

abstract.p: David Kinyon reply to Aug 13 letter holds it is impossible to compare Pres Clinton's scandals to Watergate affair; holds ex-Pres Richard M Nixon brought nation to brink of constitutional disaster (S)

block.p: An Aug. 13 letter states that President Richard M. Nixon, unlike President Clinton, had enough ''respect for the office of the President'' that he resigned rather than drag the Presidency through the mud. Have we forgotten about the Saturday Night Massacre, that fateful day when Mr. Nixon brought this nation to the brink of constitutional disaster?

An Aug. 13 letter states that President Richard M. Nixon, unlike President Clinton, had enough ''respect for the office of the President'' that he resigned rather than drag the Presidency through the mud. Have we forgotten about the Saturday Night Massacre, that fateful day when Mr. Nixon brought this nation to the brink of constitutional disaster?
Until and unless President Clinton fires Attorney General Janet Reno and Kenneth W. Starr, the independent counsel, it is impossible to compare the scandals in the Clinton White House to Watergate.
